The 2,576 files were released by DCLeaks, a website which claims to be “launched by the American hacktivists who respect and appreciate freedom of speech, human rights and government of the people.”

The documents are from multiple departments of Soros’ organizations.
Hundreds of internal documents from groups run by prominent billionaire liberal donor George Soros were leaked online Saturday after hackers infiltrated the groups.
Documents in the leak range from research papers such as “SOMALIS IN EUROPEAN CITIES PORTFOLIO REVIEW” to specific financials of grants.
Files come from sections representing almost all geographical regions in the world, “the President’s Office”, and something named SOUK.
DCLeaks previously released emails from Air Force Gen. Philip Breedlove, the supreme commander of NATO forces in Europe.
Bloomberg reported that the foundation notified the Federal Bureau of Investigation to the hacking.
Soros’ the Open Society Foundations seems to be the group with the most documents in the leak.
The emails showed Breedlove upset with Obama’s reluctance to address Russian aggression.
In June, the Open Society Foundations also had several documents leaked by DCLeaks.
DCLeaks has been alleged to be a Russian-backed source.
There are documents dating from at least 2008 to 2016.
